message.content:
cs.NE, cs.DM, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SY

The paper discusses the learning and generalization performance of random Boolean networks, which are commonly studied in the field of neural networks and machine learning. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a new measure to describe the network's learning and generalization behavior, which falls under the scope of cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The study of learning and generalization is also relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning), and the use of state-topology evolution is related to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the investigation of the influence of system size and connectivity falls under the scope of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
